vote.title: To Recognize the 43rd Nationwide Children’s Hospital Columbus Marathon for Celebrating Racing in the Community, Exceptional Fundraising, and Groundbreaking Research.
vote.description:
Title
To Recognize the 43rd Nationwide Children’s Hospital Columbus Marathon for Celebrating Racing in the Community, Exceptional Fundraising, and Groundbreaking Research.
 
Body
WHEREAS, Nationwide Children’s Hospital is honored to be the title beneficiary for the Columbus Marathon & 1/2 Marathon and 2023 marks the 12th year of the strong partnership; and 
 
WHEREAS, Thus far, more than $12 million has been raised for the Hospital.  This includes more than $1.3 million contributed since 2012 by the Columbus Marathon Board of Directors; and
 
WHEREAS, the 43rd Nationwide Children’s Hospital Columbus Marathon and 17th annual ½ Marathon will take place on Sunday, October 15, 2023 in the heart of the Capital City; and
 
WHEREAS, we encourage everyone to register and fundraise for the Nationwide Children’s Hospital Columbus Marathon & ½ Marathon, so that one day we can celebrate finding cures for all of the patients. Dedicate your race to the kids helped by this incredible institution, by running or walking 13.1 or 26.2 miles; and
 
WHEREAS, there will be two additional events on Saturday, Oct. 14 as part of Marathon weekend - the Jesse Owens 5K and 1 Mile Fun Run & Walk presented by Park National Bank. The 5K will be a timed race for runners and walkers and the 1 Mile Fun Run & Walk will be an untimed family friendly event; and 
 
WHEREAS, the Columbus Marathon also partners with Columbus Recreation and Parks Department to host the Highlights’ Kids Run on Saturday, Oct. 14 for free for children ages 3 to 11; now, therefore
 
BE IT RESOLVED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF COLUMBUS: 
 
That this Council recognizes the runners, walkers, volunteers and supporters of the Nationwide Children’s Hospital Columbus Marathon & 1/2 Marathon; further, we celebrate our community's youngest patients, honor those who have succumbed to their illnesses, and support the family and friends who stood by them, for their determination and courage.
